meanings.definition: Having a thin or awkward appearance
meanings.sent1: The tree in our backyard looked even scrawlier after losing its leaves in the fall.
meanings.sent2: The scrawlier cat struggled to fit through the narrow gap in the fence.
meanings.sent3: The scrawlier scarecrow in the field seemed to be dancing in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her scrawlier shadow stretched out long and thin in the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The scrawlier branches of the old oak tree reached out like bony fingers.

meanings.definition: Writing or drawing in a messy or illegible manner
meanings.sent1: His notebook was filled with scrawlier handwriting that was hard to decipher.
meanings.sent2: The scrawlier on the wall made it difficult to understand the message.
meanings.sent3: The scrawlier on the grocery list made her accidentally buy the wrong items.
meanings.sent4: The scrawlier on the map led them in circles, lost in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The scrawlier in the old book looked like a secret code waiting to be cracked.
